I checked your GitHub/account data and your inbox for the invitation.

What I found
- Repository alicemiller/sorting_searching shows a pending collaborator: emma.johnson@bluesparrowtech.com (your email).
- I checked the GitHub-linked unread emails inbox — there were no unread GitHub invitation emails.
- Today’s date (for context): 2024-05-19.

What this means
- Alice has sent an invitation and it’s currently pending (not yet accepted). The invitation exists on GitHub, but I could not find the invitation email in your GitHub-linked unread messages. The invite can also be accepted directly from your GitHub account (notifications/invitations or from the repo page) even if the email is missing.

How to accept the invitation (quick steps)
1. Sign into GitHub with your account (emmajohnson).
2. Check GitHub’s Invitations/Notifications:
   - Notifications: https://github.com/notifications
   - Direct invitations: https://github.com/notifications/invitations
3. Alternatively, open the repository page while logged in:
   - https://github.com/alicemiller/sorting_searching
   - If invited, GitHub usually shows a banner or button to “Accept invitation” on that repo page.
4. If you don’t see anything on GitHub, check your email (including Spam, Promotions, other inbox tabs) for a message from notifications@github.com containing an “Accept invitation” link.

If you want me to help further
- I can send a short email to Alice asking her to re-send or to confirm the invite (I can send it now if you want). Below is a suggested draft you can use or I can send it for you:

  Subject: Quick resend of collaborator invite for alicemiller/sorting_searching
  Body:
  Hi Alice,
  I was told you invited emma.johnson@bluesparrowtech.com as a collaborator on alicemiller/sorting_searching but I can't find the invitation email. Could you please re-send the invite or confirm it's still pending so I can accept it?
  Thanks — Emma Johnson, Blue Sparrow Tech

Tell me if you’d like me to send that email to Alice (I can send it now), or I can try any other checks you’d like me to run.
